alert.note: Alert for Lonoke; Prairie; White (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 6:31PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Prairie, northeastern Lonoke and south central White Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 631 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near McCreanor, or 7 miles southeast of Lonoke, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lonoke... Beebe... Carlisle... Barrettsville... Thurman... McCreanor... Prairie Center... Sisemore... Parkers Corner... Screeton... Hayley... Butlerville... Hickory Plains... Woodlawn... Culler... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 175 and 189. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
